conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the two different magnetic fields B1 and B2.
The particle will move in circular paths in each magnetic field due to the Lorentz force.
Determine the radius of the circular path in each magnetic field using R = mv/qB.
For magnetic field B1, R1 = mv/qB1.
For magnetic field B2, R2 = mv/qB2.
Given B1 = 2B2, substitute B1 in terms of B2: R1 = mv/(2qB2).
R2 = 2R1, so the radius in B2 is twice the radius in B1.
Determine the period of the circular motion in each magnetic field using T = 2πm/qB.
T2 = 2T1, so the period in B2 is twice the period in B1.
Determine the time for the particle to return to point O.
Time to move in a semicircle in B1: t_semicircle in B1 = T1/2 = πm/(2qB2).
Time to move in a semicircle in B2: t_semicircle in B2 = T2/2 = πm/qB2.
Total time to return to point O: t_total = t_semicircle in B1 + t_semicircle in B2 + t_semicircle in B1.
The total time for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 2πm/qB2.
